item.title: World's Most Popular VTuber Wins Landslide Victory in Official Top 10 Streaming Ranking - CBR
Hololive DEV_IS Vtuber Hiodoshi Ao Is on a Hiatus - Siliconera
Outside Director Kimiyuki Suda Unravels COVERâ€™s Growth Journey and Future Challenges Build on Relationship of Trust Spanning 20 Years
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: When COVER was founded in 2016, it was developing a VR table tennis game in a modest multi-tenant building in Shibuya. After that, I also watched in real time as the Company shifted its focus to the VTuber business. At first, COVER didnâ€™t have a clear direction, but as it continued its research into voice apps and surveyed illustrators, and with the backdrop of the emergence of Kizuna AIâ€”the worldâ€™s first virtual YouTuberâ€”the pieces gradually came together.A major turning point for the Company was when Mr. Tanigo spoke at the Infinity Ventures Summit (IVS) held in December 2017. His presentation at IVS was the trigger for spreading the COVER name in the startup community. Until then, it had been difficult to gain the understanding of investors regarding the VTuber business, but the situation flipped after the presentation at IVS, and COVER received many offers for funding on the same day.My most memorable touchpoint with COVERâ€™s fans was the first concert held by hololive production at Toyosu PIT. At the time, I was somewhat skeptical about holding the concert, but I was blown away by the excitement of the audience waving their glow sticks at the venue.During the event, there was a technical glitch that caused the concert to be temporarily interrupted. A prolonged silence during a concert is quite a mess, isnâ€™t it? After a while, people here and there in the audience started to shout encouragement along the lines of â€œYou got this!!â€ (aimed at the concert organizers)Â Then, someone shouted â€œYAGOO (CEO Tanigoâ€™s nickname), You got this!â€, and before we knew it, the whole auditorium transformed into a frenzied chorus of â€œYAGOO! YAGOO!â€Â Â I got goosebumps from the sense of unity at that moment. After that, hololive production grew steadily as a business including its global expansion. Looking back, the road to listing seems to have been relatively smooth, but in reality the problems were endless (lol). My impression is that the Company has grown through a variety of experiences, including these kinds of problems. I also believe the presence of rivals in the industry has been a positive for market growth.

item.title: Octopus x hololive Gen 0 Virtual Cards are Available from March 14th - ãƒ›ãƒ­ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ€ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³
Octopus x hololive Gen 0 Virtual Cards are Available from March 14th
item.author: Horii
item.content:encoded: COVER Corporation has announced a new collaboration between hololive production and Octopus Card, introducing exclusive virtual card images featuring hololive Gen 0 talents. These special edition Octopus Card images are available for purchase through the â€œOctopus Card Image Storeâ€.As one of the most widely used smart payment systems in Hong Kong, Octopus Card will release a set of five unique virtual card images featuring Tokino Sora, Roboco-san, AZKi, Sakura Miko, and Hoshimachi Suisei. Each design features the talents in traditional Hong Kong style outfits, enjoying iconic local street food and embracing the cityâ€™s vibrant culture.The hololive Gen 0 virtual card images will be available exclusively on the â€œOctopus Card Image Storeâ€ starting from March 14th, 2025 at HK$38 each.During the sales period, all fans who purchase the card will automatically qualify for a giveaway event. Stay tuned to Octopusâ€™ official social media channels for details on entry requirements and giveaway announcements.For more information, please visit the official Octopus social media accounts. Octopus is a contactless stored value card that provides customers with a simple, safe, and secure way to pay. First launched in 1997 across public transport systems, the applications of the Octopus card have since expanded to include retail stores and various facilities, making everyday life more convenient.

item.title: hololive performs at the Final Act of â€œENTRY Inc. presents Japan Expo Paris in Osaka 2025â€ at the Osaka-Kansai Expo! | NEWS | hololive official website - ãƒ›ãƒ­ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ€ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³
hololive performs at the Final Act of â€œENTRY Inc. presents Japan Expo Paris in Osaka 2025â€ at the Osaka-Kansai Expo!
item.author: maki
item.content:encoded: COVER Corp., the company behind the VTuber agency â€œhololive production,â€ is pleased to announce that hololive will perform at â€œENTRY Inc. presents Japan Expo Paris in Osaka 2025,â€ held at the Osaka-Kansai Expo on April 26th (Sat) and 27th (Sun), 2025.Confirmed as the Final Act for â€œENTRY Inc. presents Japan Expo Paris in Osaka 2025â€!Talents from hololive, hololive Indonesia, and hololive English will come together for a special showcase during the â€œ2nd partâ€ on April 27th at the EXPO Arena of the Osaka-Kansai Expo. This will be a one-night-only performance that you wonâ€™t want to miss! To attend, advance reservations are required through the official Osaka-Kansai Expo website. The â€œ2nd partâ€ performance will be available through a lottery system, and applications must be submitted via the Expoâ€™s official website up to 8 days before the event. Donâ€™t miss this special opportunity! We look forward to your applications. Hoshimachi Suisei, Sakura Miko, Nakiri Ayame, Oozora Subaru, Usada Pekora, Shirogane Noel, Houshou Marine, Amane Kanata, Tsunomaki Watame, Kobo Kanaeru, Mori Calliope, Shiori Novella, Koseki Bijou, Nerissa Ravencroft, Fuwawa Abyssgard, Mococo Abyssgard.Note: Performers are subject to change without notice.Japan Expo Paris in Osaka Information

item.title: Whatâ€™s Ahead for the VTuber Industry: Looking to the Future with COVER CFO Yosuke Kaneko
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: I grew up with anime and games since childhood, and I have always been fond of such culture. My father was an art dealer, and that gave me a lot of exposure to contemporary and other types of art. So from an early age I developed a strong interest in art and creativity. When I think about it, there may be a sense in which I perceive entertainment, such as games and anime, in an artistic way.When I was working in the London branch of a securities firm around 2018, I watched quite a lot of YouTube in my free time and was quite interested in the trends in VTuber culture. In those days, the popularity of Japanese manga, anime, and Vocaloid culture was gradually spreading throughout London. Later, the under the pandemic lockdown, anime and internet culture became popular with mass audiences through Netflix and other media. I was in London at a time when such Japanese culture was becoming mainstream, and I was also keeping a close watch on the new VTuber culture that was emerging from Japan and gaining momentum.Also, from my perspective as a consumer, I was struck by the uniqueness and novelty of VTubersâ€™ creativity. At the time, I was witnessing the birth of various start-ups in Japan and abroad, creating new value in the world. I felt that VTubers had great potential to create a new industry by utilizing the uniqueness of Japan.After that, the stimulus for my joining COVER was applying for the position of international business development manager. When I had the opportunity to speak with Tanigo during that process, I shared my thoughts on how to achieve sustainable business expansion and growth. COVER in 2021 had more than 100 employees and was preparing to relocate its office. Amid the rapid and intense expansion of COVER and its customer base, it was decided that I would officially join the team upon completing my assignment in London. In February, I began working as the GM of the Corporate Planning Office. Back then, I worked in business planning in a newly established department and later was appointed CFO.

item.title: ANYCOLORâ€™s Q3 Report: Record Growth in Livestreaming and Commerce
item.author: Thomas Toblu
item.content:encoded: ANYCOLOR, the powerhouse behind the beloved Nijisanji project, is once again making headlines. Their latest quarterly report for FY2025 Q3 reveals record-breaking performance. It also outlines a strategic vision that promises even more growth in the coming years. This article will break down the key highlights of the report. In this in-depth article, weâ€™ll explore the major segments of ANYCOLORâ€™s businessâ€”from livestreaming and commerce to events and promotions. Read also: Coverâ€™s latest financial report!To summarize the key points from ANYCOLORâ€™s FY2025 Q3 report: Total revenue surged to 11,564 million JPY, driven largely by robust performance in commerce and live events. The livestreaming segment remains the backbone of ANYCOLORâ€™s revenue, providing consistent income and deep community engagement. Overcoming previous challenges, the commerce segment set new sales records with impressive order backlogs. Domestic live events broke records, underlining the continued appetite for immersive, in-person experiences.Critical Challenges for Nijisanji English: Unlike its domestic counterpart, NijiEN is facing declining revenue. There are fewer live events. Viewership is dwindling. These issues signal the need for a strategic overhaul. ANYCOLORâ€™s ambitious targets aim for increased revenue and profit. The company is making heavy investments in technology and talent. These actions position the company for a bright future, despite current challenges. Operational risks and market dynamics present challenges. However, ANYCOLORâ€™s diversified approach offers significant opportunities. Their commitment to innovation also creates opportunities.Key Financial Highlights: Whatâ€™s New in Q3?ANYCOLORâ€™s FY2025 Q3 report is packed with numbers, but here are the standout points in plain language:The company posted a total revenue of 11,564 million JPY for the quarter. This marks an impressive year-over-year increase of nearly 50%. This boost is a testament to the companyâ€™s growing fan engagement and its ability to monetize its diverse offerings.ANYCOLOR operates several core business segments: This segment saw steady growth. Itâ€™s driven by the subscription and membership model that many VTubers use, ensuring a consistent revenue stream. The commerce segment comprises merchandise sales, digital content, and other online transactions. It experienced a remarkable jump of over 66% compared to the previous year. Record sales figures and an impressive order backlog point to a surge in fan spending. ANYCOLORâ€™s live events are a huge hit with fans. The event-related revenue increased by nearly 93%. Events such as music festivals and countdown shows are especially popular. The promotional side of the business also performed strongly, supporting brand awareness and cross-channel marketing strategies.Alongside revenue growth, ANYCOLOR saw its operating profit increase by 64.3% to 4,204 million JPY. Net income also shot up by nearly 64%. This indicates effective cost management by the company. At the same time, it is expanding its revenue base.These numbers highlight ANYCOLORâ€™s robust performance in Q3. They also suggest a solid foundation for future growth. This is especially true as the digital entertainment landscape continues to evolve.Livestreaming: The Heartbeat of the VTuber WorldFor many fans, the magic of VTubers comes alive during live streaming sessions. ANYCOLORâ€™s livestreaming segment remains a key pillar of its business model. Hereâ€™s why:Steady and Reliable Revenue:Livestreaming uses a membership-driven model. Fans subscribe to get exclusive content, perks, and closer interaction with their favorite VTubers. In Q3, livestreaming revenue reached 1,301 million JPYâ€”a modest but steady increase from the previous year.Live streams are more than just a revenue streamâ€”theyâ€™re a way for fans to build community. Livestreaming offers interactivity and real-time connection. These aspects help solidify fan loyalty. As a result, other revenue streams like merchandise sales and event participation are driven.Ad Revenue and Sponsorships:Beyond memberships, livestreaming brings in ad revenue and sponsorship deals. ANYCOLORâ€™s ability to maintain a strong viewer base ensures that these revenue streams remain healthy.Overall, livestreaming is the heartbeat of ANYCOLORâ€™s VTuber ecosystem, providing both financial stability and a vibrant platform for fan interaction.ANYCOLORâ€™s commerce segment is where the company is truly breaking new ground. The revenue reached 7,204 million JPY in Q3. This is a staggering increase compared to previous periods. This segment is driving much of the overall growth. Letâ€™s dive into whatâ€™s behind this success:Record Sales and Order Backlog:The report highlights that commerce revenue reached its highest-ever quarterly level. Large-scale initiatives and innovative marketing strategies led to sales figures that far exceeded targets. Fans have been enthusiastic about purchasing exclusive merchandise and digital content, resulting in a significant order backlog. This backlog even points to the fact that fans are eagerly waiting for new products and initiatives.Overcoming Operational Challenges:Previous quarters had been hampered by shipping delays, which negatively affected sales. However, in Q3, ANYCOLOR managed to clear these issues, ensuring that products reached fans in a timely manner. This operational improvement has been a major contributor to the record performance.The shift towards online commerce isnâ€™t just about selling productsâ€”itâ€™s about creating an engaging, seamless experience for fans. ANYCOLOR has invested in digital tools. They use e-commerce platforms that make it easier for fans to access exclusive content. They also help to access merchandise. This digital-first approach is crucial in todayâ€™s market, where convenience and speed are paramount.Impact on the Fan Community:For fans, buying merchandise is a way to show support. It also helps them connect with their favorite VTubers. The strong performance in commerce reflects not only effective sales strategies but also the deep engagement of ANYCOLORâ€™s fan base. Fans are willing to invest in the brand, whether itâ€™s limited-edition items or exclusive digital content. That commitment is translating into impressive revenue figures.Event Success: Record-Breaking MilestonesLive events have always been a cornerstone of the VTuber experience. In Q3, ANYCOLORâ€™s event segment showed extraordinary growth:Massive Revenue Increase:Event revenue climbed to 1,428 million JPY. This is almost double compared to the previous year. ANYCOLORâ€™s live events are clearly resonating with fans. High-profile events such as music festivals and countdown shows have exceeded expectations, both in terms of attendance and sales.Fan Excitement and Community Building:Events create a unique atmosphere that blends live performance with digital interaction. They create a connection between the virtual and the real. Fans can experience the charisma and energy of their favorite VTubers in person or through high-quality digital streams. This immersive experience drives both ticket sales and ancillary revenues, such as exclusive event merchandise.The report notes that Q3 events were successful. This success occurred despite some cancellations and postponements earlier in the fiscal year. These events not only recovered lost ground, but also set new records. This demonstrates ANYCOLORâ€™s ability to adapt, plan, and execute large-scale events that meetâ€”and even exceedâ€”fan expectations.The Q4 outlook is equally promising, with planned events that are expected to generate even higher revenue. ANYCOLOR plans to continue its winning streak in live event production. They are implementing initiatives like â€œNIJISANJI FES 2025â€. They are also collaborating with major venues like Tokyo Dome City.Promotion plays a crucial role in ANYCOLORâ€™s integrated strategy. Although the promotional segment saw a modest revenue increase in Q3 (1,618 million JPY), its importance should not be underestimated:Promotion is all about maintaining the brandâ€™s presence and engaging with fans across multiple platforms. ANYCOLOR has successfully aligned its promotional activities with broader market trends. This alignment ensures that its VTubers remain relevant and visible.Supporting Other Segments:Effective promotion not only boosts direct revenue through sponsorships and ad deals. It also drives traffic to livestreams, commerce sites, and live events. In this way, promotional efforts serve as a critical support system for the entire business ecosystem.Strategic Resource Allocation:The report indicates that some VTuber resources were shifted to support major events. Despite this, the promotional segment has performed consistently. Maintaining this balance ensures immediate revenue spikes from some initiatives. Meanwhile, the overall brand remains strong and continually attracts new fans.A Critical Look at Nijisanji English (NijiEN)While ANYCOLORâ€™s domestic operations continue to thrive, the international armâ€”Nijisanji English (NijiEN)â€”is showing signs of strain. NijiEN faces several challenges. These could affect its long-term prospects, unlike the robust performance of its Japanese counterpart.The data suggests that NijiENâ€™s revenue has been on a downward trajectory. The international segment is an essential part of ANYCOLORâ€™s global strategy. However, it has not achieved the same financial momentum as the domestic division. The report indicates that NijiENâ€™s revenue, which once showed promise, is now experiencing a decline compared to previous quarters. This downturn is a significant concern. This is especially true because the international market is expected to be a major growth driver for the VTuber industry.The Vanishing Live EventsOne of the most glaring differences between NijiEN and its domestic counterpart is the lack of live events. The domestic group has continued to generate substantial revenue from live events. These include record-breaking shows and festivals. However, NijiEN has not maintained a consistent event schedule. In recent quarters, NijiEN has seen little to no investment in live events. This absence is critical. Live events are not only a major revenue source. They are also a key way to engage and expand the fan community. The lack of high-profile events is adding to NijiENâ€™s struggles. It may be a missed opportunity to tap into international enthusiasm for immersive experiences.Dwindling Viewership and EngagementAnother red flag for NijiEN is the noticeable decline in viewership numbers. In a space where active and engaged audiences are the lifeblood of success, dwindling viewership can have a severe impact. It creates a cascading effect on revenue streams. This ranges from livestreaming subscriptions to digital merchandise sales. Critics and industry insiders have noted that NijiENâ€™s viewership metrics have been slipping. Strategic Implications and the Need for a Course CorrectionThe challenges faced by Nijisanji English raise important questions about its current strategy. As ANYCOLOR continues to invest heavily in domestic operations with strong returns, NijiENâ€™s performance appears to lag behind. Relying solely on digital revenue streams may not be sufficient to sustain growth. Live events provide an energizing boost that is needed in a competitive international market.For NijiEN to turn the tide, a re-evaluation of its approach is necessary. This might include:Revamping Content Strategy: Developing fresh, engaging content that resonates with international audiences and combats the stagnation in viewership.Reintroducing Live Events: Investing in live or hybrid digital-physical events could reinvigorate the fan community. These events could drive up engagement and open up new revenue opportunities.Enhanced Marketing Efforts: Strengthening promotional campaigns targeted at global markets may help recapture lost viewers. These campaigns can also drive renewed interest in NijiENâ€™s offerings.Nijisanji English holds tremendous potential due to its international appeal. However, these current challenges suggest that ANYCOLOR needs to act swiftly. Failing to address declining revenue and engagement could undermine the segmentâ€™s long-term viability. It would also impact its role in ANYCOLORâ€™s global expansion strategy.The Future of their VTubers: ANYCOLORâ€™s Strategic VisionANYCOLORâ€™s FY2025 Q3 report isnâ€™t just a snapshot of current performanceâ€”itâ€™s a roadmap for their future. Here are some key strategic insights:Ambitious Growth Targets:ANYCOLOR aims to increase its sales by 88% and operating profit by 94% by FY2027. This ambitious target is supported by robust strategies. These strategies include expanding the VTuber roster by 10â€“15% per year. They also focus on increasing revenue per VTuber through enhanced support and targeted initiatives.Investment in Infrastructure and Technology:The company is investing heavily in upgrading its production studios. These upgrades include state-of-the-art motion capture and augmented reality (AR) facilities. These technological advancements are expected to boost the quality of VTuber content, providing fans with an even more immersive experience.Strengthening Talent Development:ANYCOLOR continues to invest in its Virtual Talent Academy (VTA). This program is designed to discover new VTuber talent. It also nurtures that talent. By ensuring a steady pipeline of fresh talent, the company secures new stars. This approach helps it to maintain its leadership in the VTuber space for years to come.Diversification of Revenue Streams:ANYCOLORâ€™s integrated ecosystem performs strongly in livestreaming, commerce, events, and promotion. This design helps it withstand market fluctuations. The diversification strategy not only stabilizes revenue but also creates multiple touchpoints for fan engagement.The growing importance of Nijisanji English highlights ANYCOLORâ€™s commitment to expanding its global footprint. Digital media consumption continues to rise worldwide. The company is poised to capture new audiences. It will also generate additional revenue streams.Risks, Challenges, and OpportunitiesNo business is without its challenges. ANYCOLORâ€™s report also outlines some risks and the strategies in place to address them:While previous quarters saw issues such as shipping delays, ANYCOLOR has implemented measures to ensure smoother operations. The record commerce numbers in Q3 indicate that these challenges are being overcome effectively.Talent and Human Resources:In a highly competitive industry, attracting and retaining top talent is crucial. ANYCOLOR is actively enhancing its training programs and recruitment strategies. This ensures that its VTubers and production teams can keep up with growing demand.The VTuber industry is dynamic and often influenced by trends. ANYCOLORâ€™s diversified approach covers digital content, live events, and e-commerce. This approach helps mitigate the risk of depending too heavily on any single revenue source.Opportunities for Innovation:Technological advances offer many opportunities. There is increasing global interest in digital entertainment. As a result, there is significant potential for ANYCOLOR to innovate further. Whether itâ€™s through enhanced interactive features during livestreams or new forms of digital merchandise, the opportunities are vast.What This Means for Fans and Casual ViewersIf youâ€™re a fan of Nijisanji or just a casual viewer interested in the world of VTubers, hereâ€™s why this report matters to you:More High-Quality Content:The strategic investments in technology and talent development are crucial. These investments mean you can expect even better, more immersive content from your favorite VTubers. Whether youâ€™re tuning in for a live stream or watching exclusive digital releases, the quality is set to improve.ANYCOLOR has record-breaking event revenue. They have a robust pipeline of upcoming events. ANYCOLOR is clearly doubling down on delivering unforgettable live experiences. Expect more interactive shows, music festivals, and special collaborations that will bring the community together in exciting ways.The focus on digital commerce and online communities is increasing. Your favorite VTubers will be more accessible than ever. From exclusive merchandise to special membership perks, there will be plenty of opportunities for fans to engage and show support.A Global VTuber Community:The success of Nijisanji English is a signal that the VTuber community is expanding globally. For casual viewers, this means more diverse content that reflects a variety of cultures. It also showcases different styles, enriching the overall VTuber experience.Final Thoughts: A Dynamic Future for Virtual EntertainmentNYCOLORâ€™s FY2025 Q3 financial report highlights a company that is excelling in many areas. However, it is also facing significant challenges. This is especially true in its international division, Nijisanji English. With record-breaking revenue and a strong domestic performance, ANYCOLOR is clearly a leader in the VTuber revolution. However, the issues highlighted in NijiEN serve as an important reminder. Even industry giants must continually adapt and innovate to stay ahead.For long-time fans and newcomers alike, the report is a testament to the dynamic, fast-evolving nature of virtual entertainment. You might be excited by the prospect of more high-quality livestreams. You could be intrigued by innovative digital merchandise. Alternatively, you may be concerned about the challenges facing international content. ANYCOLORâ€™s report offers insights that are both inspiring and cautionary.ANYCOLORâ€™s FY2025 Q3 financial report is a landmark document. It showcases record-breaking revenue and effective management of costs. The report also presents a clear strategic vision for the future of their VTubers. You may be captivated by the charm of your favorite VTubers. You might also be curious about how digital entertainment is evolving.

item.title: hololive SUPER EXPO 2025 & hololive 6th fes. â€“ UNDONE Arcade Theme Watch & Merch Collection Now Available for Pre-Order
item.author: Horii
item.content:encoded: COVER Corporation has announced that the UNDONE x hololive production â€“ hololive SUPER EXPO 2025 & hololive 6th fes. â€“ GAMEONE watch and merch collection is now available for pre-order. The collection set will feature all members of hololive production to commemorate UNDONEâ€™s gold sponsorship of hololive SUPER EXPO 2025 & hololive 6th fes.UNDONE GAMEON collection is inspired by an arcade theme, offering fans a choice between two exclusive timepieces: THE ARCADE SHOOT and THE ULTIMATE SHOOTER. These watches feature unique customization options, allowing fans to immortalize any of the 90 hololive production talents on the case back. Beyond the single watch option, UNDONE introduces an exclusive GAMEON KIT that includes both a wristwatch and a matching desk clock. For the ultimate collectors, thereâ€™s the limited arcade machine boxset, with only 1,000 available, each printed with unique serial numbers to celebrate this special event.UNDONE, as the gold sponsor of the event, has launched the GAMEON collection inspired by the eventâ€™s arcade theme. This collection offers fans a choice between two exclusive timepieces: THE ARCADE SHOOT and THE ULTIMATE SHOOTER. These watches feature unique customization options, allowing fans to immortalize any of the 90 hololive production talents on the case back. Beyond the single watch option, UNDONE introduces an exclusive GAMEON KIT that includes both a wristwatch and a matching desk clock. For the ultimate collectors, thereâ€™s the limited arcade machine boxset, with only 1,000 available, each printed with unique serial numbers to celebrate this special event!Merchandise bundled with the watch set includes arcade coins, key visual coin sets, watch cleaning cloths, playing cards, puzzle sets, passport holders and more.GAMEON Watch & Merch CollectionPre-Order: March 7th, 5PM (EST) (March 8th, 7AM JST) â€“ April 30th, 11:59 PMFor more information, please visit the official website of UNDONE.

item.title: Feelings Transcend Dimensions â€“ VTuber Group hololive production Releases Branding Video in a Joint Development Between VTubers and Creators Across Dimensions.
item.author: narita
item.content:encoded: COVER Corporation (Minato-ku, Tokyo; CEO: Tanigo Motoaki) has released a branding video for hololive production titled â€œFeelings Transcend Dimensionsâ€ on March 7th, 2025.The video will be streaming on some digital billboards, and on the official hololive production website and social media accounts (TikTok, YouTube, and X).Talent Appearances: Hoshimachi Suisei, Houshou Marine, Kobo Kanaeru, Takanashi Kiara, ReGLOSS Creator Appearances: Tsumiki, Araki Yuka, HoneyWorks, Mumeixxx, Sawamura Kirariâ€œFeelings Transcend Dimensionsâ€ Branding VideoThe video follows the talents of hololive production working with popular creators across dimensions to create works that express their creativity in a mix of animation and live-action film.Appearing in the video are five creators: Tsumiki, who worked on the lyrics, composition and arrangement for Hoshimachi Suiseiâ€™s megahit â€œBIBBIDIBA;â€ Araki Yuka, who choreographs songs for ReGLOSS; HoneyWorks, who worked on the overall directions for hololive productionâ€™s hololive Ã— HoneyWorks project, and Mumeixxx and Sawamura Kirari, two influencers who collaborated with Houshou Marine to create dance covers. This video shows how each of these creators worked together with the talents in their respective productions.The narration is done by Iwami Manaka, who has voiced popular characters such as Kurokawa Akane from the anime Oshi no Ko.It is also currently being broadcast on some digital billboards.*When and where the video is to be shown is subject to change without notice. *Please refrain from contacting any buildings or stores about this video. *We hope you enjoy the video, but please consider your safety and do not obstruct traffic when taking photos. (We may stop broadcasting the video in emergency situations)hololive production Official Website RenewalThe design of the hololive production official website has been revamped, so please take a look as we continue to bring you all the latest hololive news.https://hololivepro.com/en Starting his career as a Vocaloid music producer in 2017, Tsumiki has risen to fame with his highly addictive songs such as the 2022 track Tokyo Shandy Rendez-vous by MAISONdes feat. KAF and Tsumiki that sparked another sensation in fan works, to go along with the smash hit â€œphonyâ€ that released in June 2021, and BIBBIDIBA, which he composed for Hoshimachi Suisei that surpassed one hundred million streams across YouTube and other streaming platforms. Araki Yukaâ€™s activities are primarily focused on providing choreography and directing performances for a myriad of 3D characters. She also established a company in 2021 for casting choreographers and motion actors. HoneyWorks is a team of creators who mainly work on video-posting platforms such as Niconico and YouTube, and has garnered over 2.5 billion streams across their videos. They create music under the â€œpositive rockâ€ genre with lots of heart-racing themes and youthful sounds. An extremely influential talent with a total of over 6.5 million followers, Mumeixxx posted her first TikTok in July 2020 and has become a sensation for her cuteness and addictiveness. She has expanded out into participating in fashion events, collaborating with companies and has also kicked off her music career. With a TikTok following of 1.39 million, twenty year-old Sawamura Kirari is the vogue of TikTok creators right now. With the MV of her debut song â€œlethal dose darlingâ€ surpassing one million views on YouTube, she is also a noteworthy artist on the rise. Hailing from Saitama Prefecture, Iwami Manaka was born on April 30th, and is currently affiliated with Raccoon Dog. Some of her notable appearances have been in works such as Ameku Takaoâ€™s Detective Karte (as Konoike Mai), Oshi no Ko (as Kurokawa Akane), and Umamusume: Pretty Derby (as Rice Shower).

item.title: hololive English Teams Up with Capcom USA for Monster Hunter Wilds Collaboration
item.author: maki
item.content:encoded: Tokyo, Japan â€“ February 28, 2025 â€“ hololive English and Capcom USA are excited to announce a special collaboration with Monster Hunter Wilds, launching today! Four hololive EN talentsâ€”Koseki Bijou, Ninomae Inaâ€™nis, Raora Panthera, and Gigi Murinâ€” have been chosen for this collaboration due to their deep love and passion for the Monster Hunter franchise. Together, theyâ€™ll bring their unique energy and creativity to this exciting crossover.The collaboration kicks off with custom Live2D Palico accessories designed by the talents themselves. These adorable Palico companions, inspired by their in-game creations, will debut during a special relay stream on February 28 (PST). Following the reveal, the talents will team up for a fun Monster Hunter Wilds gameplay stream, showcasing their Palicoes in action.And thatâ€™s just the beginning of the collaboration! Stay tuned for more exciting updates in the close future! This partnership marks the first collaboration between hololive English and Capcom USA, bringing together two innovative brands to create a unique experience for fans. By combining the creativity of hololiveâ€™s talents with the rich world of Monster Hunter Wilds, this collaboration celebrates the shared passion for gaming and community. Tune in to the Palico Reveal Relay on February 28 (PST) and follow the hashtags and for updates. Donâ€™t miss this chance to see your favorite VTubers team up with their Palico partners!About Monster Hunter WildsLaunching February 28, 2025, Monster Hunter Wilds takes players on an epic adventure in a vast, living world. Platforms: PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and Steamhttps://www.monsterhunter.com/wilds.

item.title: [Part 2]COVERâ€™s Head of International Business Development Talks about the Global Strategy for Japanese Entertainment
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: We are currently working on a medium-term plan that will take us through the next three to five years. hololive is a very unique case, as it has grown organically outside of Japan without taking any strategic measures. This is an exceptionally rare case even in the industry. We are now in the process of developing strategies for the next stage of growth while leveraging such strengths. The scale of what I can accomplish here is entirely different compared to when I was running my own company. When formulating strategies, I am constantly discovering new insights through conversations with other departments. This makes repeatedly aware of the depth of knowledge that exists within COVER. I see even more potential each time the company comes into sharper focus for me. When running a company alone, I was naturally limited by my own capacity. But now, I feel that I can take on even greater challenges as part of a team filled with experts with diverse skills.When it comes to overseas development, Iâ€™ve found that thereâ€™s almost no difference in the passion of our core fans across countries and regions. Fans share a similar level of enthusiasm and love for our content regardless of where they may be. Having said that, how those emotions filter down to the light user base varies greatly by country and region. In Japan, for example, idol and anime culture are already deeply ingrained in society, making it easier to reach a wider audience. In other countries, the journey from core fan to light user requires different steps depending on the cultural context there.Taking all that under consideration, we are particularly focusing on the North American market. In July 2024, we established COVER USA as our North American base, creating the most strategically advantageous environment for expansion. A US dollar-based market also presents an attractive opportunity from an economic perspective. hololive production is home to a broad roster of talented VTubers, and this diversity allows us to attract fans with a wide range of interests in North America as well. Additionally, through game streaming activities, we have successfully expanded our reach to new fan bases. The way we expand varies depending on the cultural foundations and economic environment, but I am aware that our growth is possible only with the support of our core fans in every region.

item.title: hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME English Edition Launching in 2025
item.author: pr
item.content:encoded: COVER Corporation (hereinafter referred to as the â€œCompany,â€ headquartered in Minato-ku, Tokyo, Japan; President & CEO: Motoaki Tanigo), hereby announces that the Company will be launching an English edition of its trading card game (TCG), â€œhololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME,â€ developed under VTuber group hololive production in 2025.The hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME is an immersive trading card game created on the concept of â€œCollaboration & Competitionâ€ designed to highlight the individuality and charm of the talents from hololive. Since its launch in Japan in September 2024, the game has received an overwhelmingly positive response from fans, so in order to make the experience as accessible as possible to hololive fans worldwide, the Company is currently working on an English edition.The English edition will retain the appeal of the original Japanese version by preserving its card designs and game rules while localizing the experience to make it even more accessible and engaging for hololive English-speaking fans. In addition, there are plans to release special cards and hold events to further excite the global fan community and enhance the overall experience.The English edition, like the Japanese version, will be distributed and operated in collaboration with Bushiroad Inc. Sales are planned to take place primarily in North America, with availability at specialty TCG stores, stationery retailers, online marketplaces, and our official online store hololive production OFFICIAL SHOP (https://hololive.hololivepro.com/en/goods/).Further details on the release schedule, sales channels, and upcoming events will be announced in due course. For the latest information, please visit our official website and follow our official social media accounts.The Company, through hololive production, is dedicated to delivering new entertainment experiences to fans worldwide. With the release of the English edition of the hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME, we are excited to bring the magic of hololive to an even wider audience.please visit our official website and follow our official social media accounts.hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAMEã€å…¬å¼ã€‘X@hololive_OCG_EN

item.title: [Part 1]COVERâ€™s Head of International Business Development Talks about the Global Strategy for Japanese Entertainment
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: After graduating from university, I joined Accenture Japan Ltd as a strategy consultant in charge of clients in the manufacturing and logistics industries. I was often involved in projects to roll out Japanese businesses worldwide, and gradually I came to want to work on developing overseas strategies in the entertainment field, which I had long been interested in.I then moved to a company founded on the â€œCool Japan Strategyâ€ promoted by the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry. As a business development manager, I was involved in the Hollywood film adaptation of Japanese works, and worked on projects to adapt popular Japanese works into films. The know-how and connections I cultivated through this path have become major assets to my career. I then joined Akatsuki Inc. where I served as Head of the COO Office and a Director at Akatsuki Entertainment USA, leading initiatives such as Hollywood film production, the launch of immersive entertainment* ventures, and new game development. I led global expansion across a wide range of fields, from live entertainment to gaming.Following Akatsukiâ€™s restructuring, I established AMMO Inc. to take over the film business. At AMMO (hereinafter AMMO), I was involved in end-to-end content production, from acquiring rights to Japanese works to financing, selecting production companies, and overseeing distribution. My projects include adapting popular manga into Hollywood films and publishing award-winning mystery novels in the United States. The Japanese entertainment industry has a relatively short history in overseas expansion, but I always had the ambition to pursue new potential in this field. The theme of combining overseas markets and entertainment has been a consistent one throughout my career.

item.title: Post-Event Report on hololive STAGE World Tour â€™24 -Soar!- - ãƒ›ãƒ­ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ€ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³
Post-Event Report on hololive STAGE World Tour â€™24 -Soar!-
item.author: Horii
item.content:encoded: We just finished the first 3D Concert World Tour of hololive production in Taipei on January 18th! We are very grateful for all the support received from fans all over the world and that we were able to spread the charm of hololive production to more than 14,000 visitors in 6 major cities within 6 months. We always appreciate the love from hololive production fans around the world and strive to give as many people as possible the chance to experience hololive production 3D concerts. In this report, we would like to share with you the excitement and milestones we have achieved together with you and the talents!About hololive STAGE World Tour â€™24 -Soar!-As hololive STAGE, we hope to bring the best 3D performances to every world stage for everyone to enjoy. The first hololive STAGE concert, a world tour, was conceptualized with the theme of â€œSoar!â€. With â€œSoar!â€ as the concert title, we wanted to fly higher and further together. In the key visual illustrated by OMOCAT, each talent has a wing symbol on their back to further emphasize this message. The first world tour featured 7 of our talents: AZKi and Tsunomaki Watame from hololive, Moona Hoshinova and Kobo Kanaeru from hololive Indonesia, as well as Takanashi Kiara, Ninomae Inaâ€™nis and Hakos Baelz from hololive English. Together, they delivered spectacular musical performances in multiple languages that were loved by international audiences. A unique experience for each show in different cities was created by varying each set list and also creating special performances tailored to the local audience. From solo, duet, to group performances in both the default and Our Bright Parade costumes and also the retro theatre-style stage, hololive STAGE World Tour â€™24 -Soar!- provided an unforgettable experience for every hololive fan, regardless of their location. To further hype up our first world tour, the fan favorite â€œShiny Smily Storyâ€ was also arranged in an EDM style. Starting from the Jakarta venue, â€œShiny Smily Storyâ€ Soar Ver. has become one of the highlights of the concert, positioned as the last song. To enhance and immortalize the experience, we also released hololive STAGE World Tour â€™24 -Soar!- merchandise in the form of T-shirts, penlights, and towels. These items were available for purchase through both hololive productionâ€™s online store and at each venueâ€™s merchandise booth. In addition, unique merchandise was available at select venues. Anime NYC 2024 (New York City)Concert Date: Friday, August 23, 2024 Venue: JAVITS CONVENTION CENTER â€“ The first show of the world tour, one day before â€œhololive English 2nd Concert -Breaking Dimensions-â€ â€“ A hololive booth with world tour photo spots. â€“ Performed 14 songs with a mix of solo and unit combinations.Indonesia Comic Con 2024 (Jakarta)Concert Date: Saturday, November 9, 2024 Venue: Jakarta Convention Center â€“ The second show of the world tour, hololive came back to jakarta after â€œVRChat Presents viv:ID CRUISE hololive Meet Asia Tourâ€ â€“ Performed cover songs popular with anime fans, they also performed â€œPretenderâ€, which is very popular in Indonesia, and ended with â€œShiny Smily Storyâ€ Soar Ver. Anime Festival Asia (Singapore)Concert Date: Saturday, November 30, 2024 Venue: Suntec Singapore Convention & Exhibition Centre â€“ This is the third year hololive held a 3D concert in Singapore. â€“ Pre-concert panels featuring Kaela Kovalskia and Ouro Kronii, as well as FUWAMOCO. â€“ AZKi and Tsunomaki Watame performed a cover song duet.Anime Weekend Atlanta (Atlanta)Concert Date: Saturday, December 15, 2024 Venue: Georgia World Congress Center â€“ Pre-concert panel starring Nerissa Ravencroft and Elizabeth Rose Bloodflame. â€“ Ninomae Inaâ€™nis, Takanashi Kiara, and Hakos Baelz graced the stage with their performance.Comic Fiesta (Kuala Lumpur)Concert Date: Saturday, December 21, 2024 Venue: Kuala Lumpur Convention Center â€“ Before the start of the concert, audiences were also served with a panel of Nerissa Ravencroft and Elizabeth Rose Bloodflame. â€“ The world tour stage was modified in adjustment to the concert hall to provide an even greater view of talents. Close to the holidays, Moona Hoshinova, Kobo Kanaeru, Takanashi Kiara and Hakos Baelz gave a spectacular performance.Concert Date: Saturday, January 18, 2025 Venue: Taipei Music Center â€“ Fans had a blast with the photo spots, flower stands corner and ad-truck outside the venue. Longer setlist featured with new songs! A new castle stage was also introduced in the middle. â€“ The audience got emotional when the encore was played with video clips from the whole tour. We were #1 in the region for 2 days. â€“ Kobo Kanael and Hakos Baelz also graced the end of the show with a cover of the popular Taiwanese song: Ai ni. With the last â€œShiny Smily Storyâ€ Soar Ver. performed at the end, the long and exciting world tour finally came to an end. Together with you and the talents, we have made history with hololive STAGE World Tour â€™24 -Soar!- and couldnâ€™t be more thrilled! We hope to see you again at future events. The world is a stage, so soar, soar, soar!

Cover Corpâ€™s Latest Financial Report: Strong Growth and Exciting Developments
item.author: Thomas Toblu
item.content:encoded: Cover Corp, the company behind Hololive, has had an incredibly successful financial quarter. Their latest financial report shows impressive growth across multiple areas, including streaming, merchandising, and live events. Letâ€™s break it down in simple terms so that any fan can understand whatâ€™s happening with the company. 11.75 billion yen (about $79 million), a from last year. 2.17 billion yen, up from last year. 1.65 billion yen, increasing by year-over-year.Where the Money is Coming FromCover Corp earns money in several ways, and all of them have been growing:Streaming & Content (2.5 billion yen, +22.9%)Their VTubers continue to attract more fans, and big year-end events helped boost revenue.Live Events (2.3 billion yen, +143.8%)Large-scale concerts and event-related Blu-ray sales have been major successes.Merchandise (5.4 billion yen, +101.7%)The Hololive Trading Card Game (TCG) is a massive hit, bringing in many new customers.Retail stores and online sales continue to expand.Licensing & Collaborations (1.47 billion yen, +17.7%)More projects with big companies and international collaborations.Expansion and ImprovementsCover Corp isnâ€™t just making moneyâ€”theyâ€™re also reinvesting in growth.North American Expansion: Business is booming in the U.S., and the company plans to expand further. Fans in Europe, the UK, and Australia now get their merchandise faster. New technology is making VTuber performances even more immersive.Growing the Hololive TCG: More tournaments and product releases are planned to keep players engaged.
